content: and knit the sts on knit to the end of needle 1 needle 2 first sock or needle 1 second sock work the third mc heel turn section with until 32 36 40 sts remain on each needle short row as described for the first section finally knit 2 rnds with cc1 anna m socks page 3/4 leg finishing continue in the established stripe pattern soak the socks in lukewarm water remove until leg measures approximately 6 6 5 7 cm excess water by rolling the socks in a towel / 2½ 2⅝ 2¾ inches less than the desired let dry flat or on sock blockers weave in final length finishing with a mc stripe ends switch to larger needles if desired work according to chart a as follows attaching and abbreviations cutting cc2 when appropriate in each round work chart a sts 1-8 a total of 7 8 9 times bor - beginning of round and then work sts 9-16 once cc 1 2 - contrast colour 1 2 k - knit switch back to smaller needles knit 2 rnds kfb - knit front and back loop with mc and 2 rnds with cc1 cut cc1 knit 1 ktbl - knit through back loop round with mc and then work *ktbl p1* ribbing k2tog - knit 2 stitches together for 12 14 16 rnds or to desired ribbing mc - main colour length bind off using any elastic bind-off m1l - make 1 left a left-leaning increase method of your choice the sample socks m1r - make 1 right a right -leaning increase have been bound off with sewn bind-off p - purl round s - round s rs - right side chart a sl - slip ssk - slip slip knit st s - stitch es ws - wrong side w&t - wrap and turn chart key anna m socks page 4/4
